translation.en: [woman 1] At the moment of death.
translation.ja: NETFLIX オリジナルドキュメンタリー NETFLIX オリジナルドキュメンタリー 死の瞬間―

translation.en: are we actually just dead or is something else going on?
translation.ja: 命は ただ死ぬのか 別の何かになるのか？

translation.en: [man 1] There's no one on the planet who doesn't have a vested interest in the question, does life go on after death?
translation.ja: 誰でも死後の世界に 強い関心を抱いてる

translation.en: [man 2] Whatever this consciousness is that we have in this life...
translation.ja: 現世の自分の意識は―

translation.en: it was also there in another life before.
translation.ja: 前世でも同じだったのか？

translation.en: [woman 2] He said, "Mom, I think I need to tell you somethin'.
translation.ja: 息子が話してくれた

translation.en: I think I used to be somebody else."
translation.ja: “以前は別人だった”と

translation.en: [woman 3] How many people here have had a near-death experience?
translation.ja: 臨死体験をした方は挙手を

translation.en: Lotta dead people here today. Welcome.
translation.ja: 死者の皆さん ようこそ

translation.en: We had to rethink everything that we believed about death and dying.
translation.ja: 死に対する信念が 根底から覆された

translation.en: [woman 4] There have always been ghosts in history.
translation.ja: 幽霊の記録は多い

translation.en: We continue to report them and see them.
translation.ja: 実際に見聞きしてきた

translation.en: To the spirits of the mansion, help us connect more deeply to your world.
translation.ja: 屋敷に宿る霊魂よ 我らを霊界深くに導け

translation.en: Is there a child on the other side connected to you?
translation.ja: あの世に お子さんが？

translation.en: Yes.
translation.ja: はい

translation.en: [man 3] There are things that science can't test.
translation.ja: 科学では解明できない

translation.en: It doesn't mean they don't happen.
translation.ja: でも起きる

translation.en: Literally, I can feel him and I know that he is there with me right now.
translation.ja: 今でも僕の隣にいる

translation.en: [woman 5] I could feel my spirit sort of peeling away from my body.
translation.ja: 魂が体から引きはがされた

translation.en: How good would it be to know there is life after death?
translation.ja: 死後の世界があったら どれだけ救われるか

translation.en: [woman] As a physician, I know that most people don't think about death really
translation.ja: 医師だから分かる 人は窮地に立つまで 死について考えない

translation.en: until they're forced to.
translation.ja: 人は窮地に立つまで 死について考えない

translation.en: But 20 years ago, I was not only physically dead, I had been dead for a while.
translation.ja: でも20年前 私は死に その状態が長く続いた

translation.en: And that experience radically changed
translation.ja: 臨死体験をしたことで―

translation.en: everything about what I am and who I am.
translation.ja: 私のすべてが変わった 整形外科医 メアリー･ニール

translation.en: In 1999, I arranged to go to Chile and kayak.
translation.ja: 1999年 カヤックをしに チリに行った

translation.en: And I was looking forward to this section of river that's well known for its waterfalls.
translation.ja: 滝で有名な川のスポットを 下りたかったの

translation.en: We put on the river and we went over the first couple of drops.
translation.ja: 川に乗り出し いくつかドロップを越えた

translation.en: This river has a very high flow.
translation.ja: 流量の多い川だから―

translation.en: So we decided to run this smaller part of the first major waterfall.
translation.ja: １つ目の大滝は 小さな分流を下ることにした

translation.en: And so I pulled out in the current.
translation.ja: 私は流れに乗った

translation.en: There was another kayaker who had sort of bobbled her way past.
translation.ja: その時 誰かがバランスを 崩しながら通り過ぎ

translation.en: And her boat was lodged sideways at the entrance.
translation.ja: 分流の入り口を 横向きに塞いだの

translation.en: So I was forced over to the main part of the waterfall.
translation.ja: 私は本流の滝に押し出された

translation.en: [laughing] I mean, I-- I knew it was not gonna be good!
translation.ja: その瞬間― マズいと思った

translation.en: My boat became pinned and I was completely submerged under ten feet of water.
translation.ja: 船体が滝つぼに飲まれ 身動きが取れなくなった

translation.en: I was not breathing.
translation.ja: 息ができず

translation.en: My torso was absolutely plastered to the front deck of the boat.
translation.ja: 上半身はフロントデッキに 押し付けられた

translation.en: I could feel my bones breaking. I thought I should be screaming,
translation.ja: 骨折もした 普通なら叫び出すはずが

translation.en: but I wasn't.
translation.ja: 平気だった

translation.en: I felt... uh, no pain, no fear, no panic.
translation.ja: 痛みも恐怖もなく パニックでもない

translation.en: I felt more alive than I've ever felt.
translation.ja: かつてないほど命を感じた

translation.en: I could feel my spirit sort of peeling away from my body,
translation.ja: 魂が体から引きはがされ

translation.en: and my spirit was then released up to the heavens.
translation.ja: 天国に向かって解放された

translation.en: I was immediately greeted by a group of somethings.
translation.ja: すぐに数人が迎えに来た 人か霊かは分からない

translation.en: I don't know what to call them. People, spirits, beings.
translation.ja: 人か霊かは分からない

translation.en: I didn't recognize any of them.
translation.ja: 会ったことはない

translation.en: But they had been important in my life story somehow.
translation.ja: でも私の人生に 重要な影響を与えた存在

translation.en: Like a grandparent who died before I was born.
translation.ja: 例えば 会ったことのない祖父母

translation.en: They were so overjoyed to welcome me and greet me and love me.
translation.ja: 彼らは大喜びして 私を迎え入れてくれた

translation.en: These beings started taking me down this pathway.
translation.ja: 私は道へと案内された

translation.en: The pathway was very thickly covered with hundreds of thousands of flowers,
translation.ja: その道には無数の花が 幾重にも咲きみだれ―

translation.en: and the aromas of flowers.
translation.ja: その道には無数の花が 幾重にも咲きみだれ― 花の香りがした

translation.en: It was exploding with every color of the universe.
translation.ja: 宇宙のあらゆる色が 爆発していた

translation.en: There was an absolute shift of time and dimension.
translation.ja: 時間と空間の感覚が まったく違う

translation.en: I experienced all of eternity in every second,
translation.ja: 永遠が１秒の中にあり

translation.en: and every second expanded into all of eternity.
translation.ja: その１秒が永遠につながる

translation.en: The pathway went to this great domed structure.
translation.ja: 道の先には 巨大なドームがあった

translation.en: I believe I was in heaven.
translation.ja: そこが天国だと思う

translation.en: God's world, whatever you wanna call it.
translation.ja: いわゆる神の世界よ

translation.en: I had an overwhelming sense of being home.
translation.ja: 故郷に戻った感覚に 満たされた

translation.en: At the same time, I could look back at the river,
translation.ja: 同時に背後には川があり

translation.en: where my body was still submerged under water.
translation.ja: 私の体は川底にあった

translation.en: [man yells] You okay?
translation.ja: 大丈夫か？

translation.en: [woman] The group of kayakers kept trying to get to me,
translation.ja: 数人のカヤッカーが 私を助けようとしてた

translation.en: but they were never able to do it.
translation.ja: でも無理だった

translation.en: And after maybe 15 minutes, they had given up rescue.
translation.ja: 15分ほど経って 彼らは救出を断念し

translation.en: They had really shifted over into a body recovery mode.
translation.ja: 遺体回収に切り替えた

translation.en: One of the guys saw my life jacket pop up downstream
translation.ja: １人が下流で 私の救命具を発見した

translation.en: and thought that maybe my husband would want it.
translation.ja: 夫が欲しがると思ったそうよ

translation.en: As he got that, he felt my body hit his leg.
translation.ja: それを取りに行く時 私の体が脚に当たり

translation.en: So he reached underwater and was able to grab my wrist.
translation.ja: 水面下で私の手首をつかんだ

translation.en: My body was bloated and purple and I had fixed eyes.
translation.ja: 私の体は膨張して紫色で 瞳孔も動かなかった

translation.en: There's absolutely no doubt...
translation.ja: 疑う余地はない

translation.en: in my own mind that I was physically dead.
translation.ja: 私の肉体は死んでた

translation.en: But I watched from the entrance to the domed structure
translation.ja: 蘇生術を施される自分を ドームから眺めていると

translation.en: as they started CPR, and I could still hear them.
translation.ja: 蘇生術を施される自分を ドームから眺めていると 彼らの声がした

translation.en: One of the guys kept calling to me to come back and take a breath.
translation.ja: １人が私に言ってた “戻ってこい まだ近くにいるはず”と

translation.en: You know, "Please come back. I know you're still here."
translation.ja: “戻ってこい まだ近くにいるはず”と

translation.en: I had been without oxygen for 30 minutes,
translation.ja: 無酸素状態が30分続いた

translation.en: and the statistical likelihood of my survival should have been zero.
translation.ja: 統計的な生存率は０％のはず

translation.en: I did not want to go back down to my body.
translation.ja: 私は体に戻りたくなかった

translation.en: I had a very, very physical sensation of being held and comforted
translation.ja: 物理的に引き止められる 心地よい感覚があり

translation.en: and reassured that everything was fine.
translation.ja: 不安は感じなかった

translation.en: But the beings told me that it wasn't my time,
translation.ja: でも その存在は言った “まだ来るな やることが残ってる”

translation.en: that I had more work to do on Earth,
translation.ja: “まだ来るな やることが残ってる”

translation.en: and that I had to go back to my body.
translation.ja: 私は戻るしかなかった

translation.en: When I opened my eyes, the guys that resuscitated me
translation.ja: 目を開けると 蘇生にあたった男性たちが 驚いてた

translation.en: were stunned.
translation.ja: 蘇生にあたった男性たちが 驚いてた

translation.en: I was in terrible shape. [laughs] I mean, I had just drowned.
translation.ja: 体はひどい状態だった 溺れたし―

translation.en: But I also had, uh... multiple broken bones and torn ligaments in my legs.
translation.ja: 何本も骨折して じん帯も損傷していた

translation.en: And I was...
translation.ja: しかも そこは―

translation.en: on the side of a river in the middle of nowhere.
translation.ja: 大自然に囲まれた川辺だった

translation.en: The guys who resuscitated me put my body on top of a boat
translation.ja: 彼らは私をカヤックに乗せて

translation.en: and then began to try to get me up the hillside.
translation.ja: 山腹に向かって歩いた

translation.en: We emerged onto a dirt road.
translation.ja: 未舗装の山道に出た

translation.en: They thought maybe someone would run and get a tractor, a horse or something.
translation.ja: そこで車か馬を 探すつもりだった

translation.en: But when we emerged onto the dirt road,
translation.ja: でも山道に出ると―

translation.en: exactly there was an ambulance, which
translation.ja: そこに救急車が止まってた 1999年のチリ南部では あり得ないことよ

translation.en: in 1999, in southern Chile, didn't exist. [laughs]
translation.ja: 1999年のチリ南部では あり得ないことよ

translation.en: It was inexplicable.
translation.ja: 奇跡だった

translation.en: It took a number of hours, but my friends got me to the hospital.
translation.ja: 何時間もかかったけど 私は病院に運ばれた

translation.en: My husband was actually told that... I probably would not survive the night.
translation.ja: 医師は“今夜が山場だ”と 夫に伝えた

translation.en: But I did.
translation.ja: でも生きた

translation.en: I was in the hospital for more than a month.
translation.ja: 入院生活は１ヵ月以上続き

translation.en: I had... several operations.
translation.ja: 何度も手術を受けた

translation.en: Then many, many months of rehab before I could walk again.
translation.ja: 再び歩けるまで 何ヵ月もかかった

translation.en: And statistically, I had zero likelihood of surviving without significant brain damage.
translation.ja: 統計的に重度の脳損傷を 免れない状態だった

translation.en: But I never actually had any brain damage.
translation.ja: でも私の脳は無傷だった

translation.en: [laughing] My kids might say something differently, but...
translation.ja: 私の子供たちは反論するけど

translation.en: I... made a complete recovery.
translation.ja: 私は元どおりに回復した

translation.en: As a physician, I'm not really in a crowd of people who want to talk about things like near death experiences.
translation.ja: 医師仲間に臨死体験について 話したがる人は少ない

translation.en: People in science often think you can't possibly believe in anything supernatural.
translation.ja: 科学に従事する人の多くは 超自然的な力を信じない

translation.en: When I went off to medical school, I would have defined death as...
translation.ja: 医学生の頃の私が 死を定義するなら―

translation.en: death, meaning physical death.
translation.ja: 物理的肉体の死

translation.en: But my near-death experience, and then what happened to my son ten years later,
translation.ja: でも自分の臨死体験と その後 息子に起きたことは

translation.en: changed my definition of death significantly.
translation.ja: 私の死の定義を大きく変えた

translation.en: I don't believe that...
translation.ja: 私たちはまだ―

translation.en: we... know everything. [laughs]
translation.ja: すべてを知らない

translation.en: [man] A near death experience, sometimes called an NDE,
translation.ja: ＮＤＥとも呼ばれる 臨死体験は―

translation.en: is a profound experience that many people have when they come close to death.
translation.ja: 死を目前にした人に起きる 衝撃的な体験だ

translation.en: Probably between ten and 20% of people whose hearts actually stop
translation.ja: 心停止者の約10～20％が 臨死体験を報告する 心停止者の約10～20％が 臨死体験を報告する 精神医学･神経行動科学 名誉教授 心停止者の約10～20％が 臨死体験を報告する

translation.en: will report these dramatic near-death experiences.
translation.ja: 心停止者の約10～20％が 臨死体験を報告する 医学博士 ブルース･グレイソン

translation.en: Here at the Division of Perceptual Studies,
translation.ja: この知覚研究室は―

translation.en: we study the possibility that something about humans may survive bodily death.
translation.ja: 意識が死後も生存する 可能性について研究してる

translation.en: [man 2] The general mainstream, materialist view of reality is that physical matter is all there is.
translation.ja: 物質主義者の主な考え方は “この世は物質的なもの”

translation.en: So when the physical brain stops working, then the consciousness ends.
translation.ja: 物質である脳が停止すれば 意識は失われる

translation.en: So the idea that there might be this consciousness piece that could continue on conflicts with a pretty basic principle.
translation.ja: つまり意識存続の考え方は 基本原理に反する

translation.en: But the question of what happens after we die
translation.ja: しかし 人は死後の世界に― しかし 人は死後の世界に― 知覚研究室長 ジム･タッカー医学博士

translation.en: is something that has intrigued humans for as long as we've been around.
translation.ja: 知覚研究室長 ジム･タッカー医学博士 知覚研究室長 ジム･タッカー医学博士 有史以前から 関心を寄せてきた

translation.en: [Bruce] We've been doing this research for almost 50 years now.
translation.ja: この研究室は 約50年前に創設された

translation.en: We study mediums, people who think they can communicate with the deceased.
translation.ja: 研究対象は 死者と交信する“霊媒師”

translation.en: We've studied deathbed visions that happen to people as they die.
translation.ja: 死の直前の“臨終期視像(お迎え)”

translation.en: We've studied reincarnation
translation.ja: “生まれ変わり”や―

translation.en: and a variety of other spontaneously occurring experiences
translation.ja: “生まれ変わり”や― 生死の境界で起きる さまざまな自然発生的現象

translation.en: on the border between life and death,
translation.ja: 生死の境界で起きる さまざまな自然発生的現象

translation.en: such as near-death experiences.
translation.ja: その１つが臨死体験だ

translation.en: If you look back in history,
translation.ja: 歴史的に見れば―

translation.en: there have been what we now call near death experiences since prehistoric times.
translation.ja: 臨死体験は 有史以前から存在していた

translation.en: But the first collection of near-death experiences was put together in 1892 by Albert Heim,
translation.ja: だが最初の研究者は 1892年のアルベルト･ハイム

translation.en: a geologist in Switzerland.
translation.ja: スイスの地質学者だ

translation.en: While climbing in the Alps, he had fallen...
translation.ja: 登山時に滑落し

translation.en: and had a beautiful experience as he was falling down the mountain.
translation.ja: 落ちながら すばらしい体験した

translation.en: He described time expanding as he went faster and faster.
translation.ja: 落下の時間が ゆっくり流れた

translation.en: And he was so struck by this experience that he started asking other mountain climbers,
translation.ja: この体験に驚いて 登山家たちに話を聞くと

translation.en: and quickly collected 30 other cases like his
translation.ja: 30人が同じ体験をしていた

translation.en: of people who had falls from great heights who had blissful experiences.
translation.ja: 高所からの落下は 至福の体験だったという

translation.en: And then in the 1960s and '70s,
translation.ja: そして1960～70年代に―

translation.en: resuscitation medicine really got started.
translation.ja: 蘇生医療が発達した

translation.en: [man] External chest compression is the best rescue technique
translation.ja: 胸部の圧迫は― 最善の人工心肺法です

translation.en: for artificial circulation.
translation.ja: 最善の人工心肺法です

translation.en: [Bruce] Which means we were bringing people back from the brink of death in larger and larger numbers.
translation.ja: 一命をとりとめる人が 次第に増えていった

translation.en: Many people came back and reported these blissful experiences
translation.ja: その大勢が至福の体験を報告

translation.en: in which they left their bodies and traveled to some other realm.
translation.ja: 肉体を離れ 別世界を旅したと話した

translation.en: Patients say they become aware of what's described as a tunnel...
translation.ja: 患者が目にしたのは― １９９８年 医学博士 レイモンド･ムーディ トンネルや道 門のような場所

translation.en: a passageway, a portal.
translation.ja: １９９８年 医学博士 レイモンド･ムーディ トンネルや道 門のような場所 トンネルや道 門のような場所

translation.en: And they go into this tunnel...
translation.ja: 彼らは そこに入った

translation.en: and when they come out,
translation.ja: たどり着いたのは―

translation.en: they come out into a very brilliant, warm, loving and accepting light.
translation.ja: たどり着いたのは― 明るく 温かく 愛に満ちた光の中だ

translation.en: [Bruce] In 1975, Raymond Moody wrote his book Life After Life,
translation.ja: 1975年のムーディの著書 「かいまみた死後の世界」は

translation.en: which caused many people, myself included,
translation.ja: 私を含めた大勢の人に 臨死体験を信じさせた

translation.en: to take near death experiences more seriously.
translation.ja: 私を含めた大勢の人に 臨死体験を信じさせた 〝死後の世界にも人生〞

translation.en: [man] When Raymond Moody's book came out,
translation.ja: ムーディの著書で 臨死体験について読んだ

translation.en: I thought that near death experiences were rubbish.
translation.ja: ムーディの著書で 臨死体験について読んだ くだらないと思った 精神神経科医 ピーター･ フェンウィック

translation.en: Had to be.
translation.ja: くだらないと思った 精神神経科医 ピーター･ フェンウィック

translation.en: And they occurred in the United States, in California and that's the end of it.
translation.ja: 精神神経科医 ピーター･ フェンウィック あれはアメリカ人だけに 起きたことで― あれはアメリカ人だけに 起きたことで―

translation.en: Would it ever cross to England? No. We're far too sensible to have experiences like this.
translation.ja: 合理的なイギリス人には 無関係だとね

translation.en: But I'm a neuropsychiatrist, and, one day, this guy walked into my consulting room.
translation.ja: だが精神神経科医の私の元に ある患者が訪ねてきた

translation.en: He'd just had a cardiac catheter go wrong,
translation.ja: 彼は心臓カテーテル手術で―

translation.en: left his body, watched the resuscitation process, and had a full near-death experience.
translation.ja: 肉体を離れ 自分の姿を見る体験をした

translation.en: And so there I was, confronted. Did I believe or did I not?
translation.ja: 初めての証言者だ 信じるべきか？

translation.en: Well, I thought that before I could draw any conclusions, that I ought to study them.
translation.ja: その答えを出す前に 研究してみることにした

translation.en: So I've been studying near death experiences for about 40 years.
translation.ja: 以後 40年ほど 臨死体験を研究してる

translation.en: The science we have, which is a materialistic science,
translation.ja: 物質主義の科学に基づけば―

translation.en: says it's all brain. All brain.
translation.ja: “脳がすべて”だ

translation.en: So when the brain stops functioning, you can't be conscious.
translation.ja: 脳の機能が止まれば 意識はなくなる

translation.en: But during a near death experience,
translation.ja: だが臨死体験では―

translation.en: you get these very wide expansions of consciousness,
translation.ja: 意識が はるか遠くまで 拡張する

translation.en: even when the brain has ceased to function.
translation.ja: 脳が機能していないのにだ

translation.en: So it can't be all brain.
translation.ja: つまり脳はすべてじゃない

translation.en: [Bruce] Near death experiences are subjective experiences...
translation.ja: 臨死体験は主観的であり―

translation.en: that are very difficult to confirm objectively.
translation.ja: 客観的な確認は難しい

translation.en: And that raises questions in the minds of many scientists.
translation.ja: 多くの科学者は納得しない

translation.en: Some of the critics of this research complain that this is just anecdotes.
translation.ja: ただの逸話だと 批判する人もいる

translation.en: Well, actually, if you look at the history of science, all science starts as collecting anecdotes,
translation.ja: だが歴史的にも科学は 逸話を収集し―

translation.en: and then finding patterns among those different stories.
translation.ja: 共通点を探すことから始まる

translation.en: And there are millions of these experiences being reported across the globe.
translation.ja: 臨死体験は 世界中に多くの事例がある

translation.en: [woman 1] I was experiencing a really bad asthma attack in my apartment.
translation.ja: 激しいぜんそく発作が起きた

translation.en: [man] I was blown up by a bomb in the Vietnam War
translation.ja: ベトナム戦争で 爆風に飛ばされ―

translation.en: and then shot through the arm, chest and neck.
translation.ja: 腕と胸と首を 銃で撃たれた

translation.en: [woman 2] I was hit broadside by a woman who was texting while she was driving.
translation.ja: メールしながら運転する 女性の車にひかれた

translation.en: [man 2] I hit my head, broke my neck, injured my spinal cord and was paralyzed right away.
translation.ja: 頭を打ち 首を骨折し 脊髄損傷で寝たきりに

translation.en: [Bruce] I've been doing this work for four decades now,
translation.ja: 40年間の研究で分かった

translation.en: and what I've found is that, no matter how you come close to death
translation.ja: 死に至る状況に関係なく―

translation.en: there are very consistent patterns in the experience itself...
translation.ja: 臨死体験には共通点がある

translation.en: and in how it affects people.
translation.ja: その影響にもだ

translation.en: For example, people all over the world will report that their sense of time was distorted.
translation.ja: 時間感覚の変容は 世界中で報告されている

translation.en: For me, there was no sense of time.
translation.ja: 時間の感覚がない

translation.en: Moments or months or millennia. I don't know.
translation.ja: 一瞬か永遠かは分からない

translation.en: I had no idea how fast it was going,
translation.ja: 速さの感覚はないのに

translation.en: but it was light speed.
translation.ja: 光の速さだった

translation.en: [Bruce] They also describe this warm, loving being of light.
translation.ja: さらに温かい光の存在

translation.en: A sense of getting information from some really high-frequency teachers.
translation.ja: 高周波にいる先人と交信して 情報を与えられる感覚だった

translation.en: Very embracing and warm and-- and caressing.
translation.ja: 包まれるように 温かく 愛される感じ

translation.en: A warm energy hug... to the brain.
translation.ja: 脳を温かいエネルギーに 抱かれる感じ

translation.en: [Bruce] And then there are things that are paranormal or otherworldly.
translation.ja: さらに超常的または あの世的な体験

translation.en: Like your ordinary senses becoming much more vivid.
translation.ja: 通常の感覚が研ぎ澄まされる

translation.en: All this grand music.
translation.ja: 荘厳な音楽が聞こえた

translation.en: Jacques Cousteau. [laughs]
translation.ja: 海にいた

translation.en: Being under the water and all these fish.
translation.ja: 海の中で魚に囲まれた

translation.en: I started dissolving, or, like that drop into the ocean, just disappearing.
translation.ja: 海に落ちる水滴のように 自分が溶けて消えた

translation.en: If I could reach out and touch a leaf...
translation.ja: 手で葉を触ると

translation.en: I became an aspect of that leaf.
translation.ja: 自分が葉になる

translation.en: I was a tiny, tiny light, a little tiny speck of light, and then I'd become a great, big light.
translation.ja: 私は小さな光で その後 大きな光になった

translation.en: [Bruce] You'll see the same phenomena from all different cultures.
translation.ja: 世界中の人が 共通の体験をする

translation.en: And they often come back feeling that it profoundly changed them.
translation.ja: そして体験者は 人格の変化を報告

translation.en: [woman 3] I see the beauty in everything now.
translation.ja: 今は すべてが美しい

translation.en: [woman 4] A hundred percent turnaround from being a hardcore, angry atheist.
translation.ja: 根っからの無神論者が 真逆の観念を持つように

translation.en: [woman 2] I no longer have any kind of a fear of death.
translation.ja: 死への恐怖が すっかり消えた

translation.en: [Bruce] What is going on here
translation.ja: 〝臨死体験〞 臨死体験は 一瞬で人を変えるのか？

translation.en: that has such power to change a person's life in a fraction of a second?
translation.ja: 臨死体験は 一瞬で人を変えるのか？ 〝１ 考え方の変化 ２ 感情の変化〞 〝３ 超常的体験 ４ あの世的体験〞

translation.en: [woman 1] Hi, everybody.
translation.ja: こんにちは

translation.en: This is the Seattle International Association for Near-Death Studies.
translation.ja: ようこそ シアトル 国際臨死体験研究会(ＩＡＮＤＳ)へ

translation.en: How many people here, by show of hands, have had a near death experience?
translation.ja: 臨死体験をした方は挙手を

translation.en: A lot of dead people here today. Welcome! [laughs]
translation.ja: 死者の皆さん ようこそ

translation.en: Near death experiences are not just butterflies and flowers
translation.ja: 臨死体験は 単にチョウや花畑― 神や光や天国を 見るだけの体験じゃない 医療ソーシャルワーカー キンバリー･シャープ

translation.en: and God and light and heaven.
translation.ja: 神や光や天国を 見るだけの体験じゃない 医療ソーシャルワーカー キンバリー･シャープ

translation.en: You will find that you have difficulties with materialism.
translation.ja: 物質主義に疑問を抱き

translation.en: Maybe with employment.
translation.ja: 仕事や―

translation.en: Probably with your marriage, if you're married.
translation.ja: 結婚も危うくなる

translation.en: Because the changes are so profound.
translation.ja: 大きな変化を伴うの

translation.en: So I began counseling people with near death experiences.
translation.ja: だから彼らの相談を受けてる

translation.en: And I have the advantage of having had a near death experience,
translation.ja: 私自身も臨死体験をしたから

translation.en: so I can honestly say, "I know how you feel."
translation.ja: 私自身も臨死体験をしたから 心から彼らに共感できる

translation.en: -I'm good. -Yeah?
translation.ja: どうぞ座って

translation.en: -Have a seat. -Thank you.
translation.ja: どうも

translation.en: [woman] I didn't just go into cardiac arrest.
translation.ja: 心停止だけでなく

translation.en: My electrolytes... flip-flopped.
translation.ja: ダネット･クラマー 電解質異常が急変したの

translation.en: I was basically poisoned.
translation.ja: ダネット･クラマー 体に毒素が回って死んだ 体に毒素が回って死んだ

translation.en: And I was gone.
translation.ja: 体に毒素が回って死んだ

translation.en: When I came back, it pulled me away from a lot of people.
translation.ja: 体験後は 人との隔たりを感じる

translation.en: It's hard to even talk to my husband...
translation.ja: 夫に話すのも難しい

translation.en: because I feel that...
translation.ja: 誰かに話せば―

translation.en: somebody is going to bring a straitjacket and throw away the key.
translation.ja: 精神科病院に 幽閉されるかもしれない

translation.en: Because what I used to know is not what I know now.
translation.ja: 以前は知らなかったことを 今は知ってる

translation.en: And I'm havin' a very hard time with it.
translation.ja: それが苦しいの

translation.en: Yeah. Feeling crazy... I'm validating you.
translation.ja: 自分をおかしいと感じるのは

translation.en: ...is part of the adjustment,
translation.ja: 適合に不可欠なの

translation.en: because everything gets so mixed up.
translation.ja: 今は すべてに困惑してる

translation.en: You died.
translation.ja: あなたは死んで

translation.en: -[laughs] -You had an experience.
translation.ja: 臨死体験をした

translation.en: You came back and now you have to live in the same world,
translation.ja: そして同じ世界に戻ってきた

translation.en: but with a completely different point of view.
translation.ja: 新しい観念と共にね

translation.en: And it's so hard when everybody else's point of view hasn't changed.
translation.ja: でも周囲の観念は変わらない

translation.en: Seattle IANDS is a place of comfort and hope,
translation.ja: ここは皆さんを励まし 支援する場所です

translation.en: validation and support, and I hope attending here...
translation.ja: ここは皆さんを励まし 支援する場所です 心と感情の落ち着きを 取り戻しましょう

translation.en: calms your heart and your emotions...
translation.ja: 心と感情の落ち着きを 取り戻しましょう

translation.en: and reminds you that this is a very temporary situation.
translation.ja: あなたがいるのは 一時的な場所―

translation.en: Life.
translation.ja: 人生です

translation.en: People attend Seattle IANDS because they've had a near death experience.
translation.ja: ここに集まるのは 臨死体験をした人たち

translation.en: People come because they're grieving and want to hear that we go on.
translation.ja: 悲しみの中にいて 前に進みたがってる

translation.en: And then people come just to hear it's real,
translation.ja: 自分の体験が夢ではなく 大勢に起きていることだと

translation.en: it really happened, and has happened to millions of people.
translation.ja: 自分の体験が夢ではなく 大勢に起きていることだと 確かめるために集う

translation.en: My experience started... incredibly enough, on a Wednesday evening.
translation.ja: 私の臨死体験は 水曜の夜に起きた ホセ･エルナンデス

translation.en: And it was Thanksgiving coming up the next day.
translation.ja: 感謝祭の前日だ

translation.en: And we were running some electrical lines on some poles... and I was up on a bucket truck.
translation.ja: 私は電線を張るため 高所作業車に乗ってた

translation.en: We kind of said, "We could save a couple of hours if I stay up on the bucket...
translation.ja: 時間節約のため バケットに乗ったまま―

translation.en: and you just maneuver the truck...
translation.ja: 車を動かした

translation.en: from space to space."
translation.ja: あちこちにね

translation.en: I hit the side of the bucket and I broke all my ribs on my right side.
translation.ja: 衝突して ろっ骨が折れた 右側全部だ

translation.en: I wound up in an emergency room.
translation.ja: 緊急治療室に運ばれ

translation.en: They gave me a medication for pain...
translation.ja: 鎮痛剤を投与された

translation.en: and it had some kind of an anti-inflammatory component. Turns out I'm allergic to it.
translation.ja: その薬の抗炎症成分に アレルギー反応が出た

translation.en: So, ultimately, my lungs shut down, I stopped breathing and my heart stopped.
translation.ja: 肺機能が停止して 心臓も止まった

translation.en: There was a tunnel, but not the way that it's typically described.
translation.ja: トンネルは よく聞く形ではなく

translation.en: I kind of fell into it.
translation.ja: 落ちて入った

translation.en: And what I saw was just color...
translation.ja: 見えたのは色だけだ

translation.en: wrapped all around me, so that I was completely integrated into it.
translation.ja: 色に包み込まれ 自分が色の一部になった

translation.en: And I could hear this color talking to me. Millions of voices.
translation.ja: その時 色が語りかけてきた

translation.en: -"Sssss." This chatter. -[whispering voices]
translation.ja: たくさんの声だ

translation.en: Then I look down and I see the ocean.
translation.ja: 見下ろすと海があり

translation.en: And then I notice a man in the water. He's about knee deep.
translation.ja: ひざ丈ほどの深さに 男性が１人いた

translation.en: Then he turns around suddenly.
translation.ja: 男が振り向く

translation.en: And, uh...
translation.ja: 彼は…

translation.en: the biggest surprise of my death, my new life...
translation.ja: 驚いたことに 私の死後の世界には―

translation.en: was that it was my father.
translation.ja: 父がいた

translation.en: Me and my dad had a very difficult relationship in life. We couldn't even hug.
translation.ja: 生前の父とは関係が悪く 抱き合うこともなかった

translation.en: So when he died, I felt totally bitter
translation.ja: 父が亡くなった時は ひどく後悔した

translation.en: and really regretful of the fact that we never were able to say we love each other or we care.
translation.ja: 大切に思ってると 伝えられなかったからだ

translation.en: So I'm lookin' at him here in this space, and I'm saying, "Oh, my gosh.
translation.ja: そこに父を見つけて思った

translation.en: This is my opportunity. My second chance to make peace with my dad."
translation.ja: “これはチャンスだ 父と仲直りができる”

translation.en: Something that I could never do in life.
translation.ja: 生前は無理だった

translation.en: So...
translation.ja: 父と―

translation.en: we hugged.
translation.ja: 抱き合った

translation.en: [crying] And we said we loved each other. We loved each other.
translation.ja: 互いに愛してると伝えた

translation.en: That has changed my life in so many ways.
translation.ja: あの臨死体験で 人生が変わった

translation.en: Just knowing that he did care.
translation.ja: 父は大切に思ってた

translation.en: That he did...
translation.ja: 私を―

translation.en: love me.
translation.ja: 愛してた

translation.en: He looked at me when he embraced me. And he let go and he just looked at me.
translation.ja: 私と抱き合いながら 父が言った

translation.en: He said, "Jose. You need to go back."
translation.ja: “ホセ　お前は戻れ”

translation.en: I'm lookin' at him, like, "What? Are you kidding me?
translation.ja: 私は“冗談だろ？”

translation.en: I like it here. This is great. I don't wanna go back."
translation.ja: “ここは最高だ 戻りたくない”

translation.en: And he said to me, "No, you gotta go back."
translation.ja: 父は“ダメだ 戻れ”と

translation.en: Whilst I didn't want to, uh...
translation.ja: ためらっていると

translation.en: we came to, kind of, sort of an agreement, in a way.
translation.ja: 父が条件を出してきた

translation.en: We-- we agreed that, when my time came, he would come get me and I said...
translation.ja: “お前が死ぬときは 迎えに行く”と

translation.en: "Well, that sounds like a pretty good deal. Let me go with that." And-- and I transitioned back.
translation.ja: 私は“それなら納得だ”と 体に戻ってきた

translation.en: I felt this sense of pull and I wound up back in my body.
translation.ja: 体内を引っぱられる 感覚がした

translation.en: When I met my dad on the other side...
translation.ja: 父に会って―

translation.en: I realized that...
translation.ja: 気付いた

translation.en: sometimes, we may not be able to say something here...
translation.ja: この世で言えなくても

translation.en: but... we're gonna be able to say it somewhere else.
translation.ja: あの世で言えることがある

translation.en: By having this opportunity...
translation.ja: この体験で―

translation.en: it truly healed my spirit.
translation.ja: 私は魂が癒された

translation.en: Before, I just was moving through life. I wasn't living.
translation.ja: 前は人生をやり過ごしてた 生きるしかばねだ

translation.en: -I was not alive. -[applause]
translation.ja: 今は違う

translation.en: Thank you.
translation.ja: どうも

translation.en: [Bruce] There have been a number of medical explanations that have been proposed to explain what causes near-death experiences.
translation.ja: これまで臨死体験について 多くの医学的仮説が出た

translation.en: I'm all in favor of that. Being a doctor, I wanna understand what causes these things.
translation.ja: 医学博士 ブルース･グレイソン 私も医師として 原因を知りたい

translation.en: Unfortunately, I don't think any of the explanations we've come up with so far
translation.ja: 残念ながら これまでの仮説では―

translation.en: help us very much in trying to understand things.
translation.ja: 臨死体験を説明できない

translation.en: Some have said drugs given to people as they're approaching death may cause near death experiences.
translation.ja: 例えば“蘇生に使う薬剤が 臨死体験を誘発する”

translation.en: And what we find is that the fewer drugs people are given...
translation.ja: 実際は投与した薬剤が 少ない人ほど

translation.en: the more likely they are to report a near death experience.
translation.ja: 臨死体験をする確率が高い

translation.en: That the drugs tend to inhibit the near-death experience, rather than causing it.
translation.ja: 薬剤は臨死体験を阻害する

translation.en: People also suggest lack of oxygen to the brain.
translation.ja: 脳の酸欠を指摘する人もいる

translation.en: And that's appealing, because no matter how you come close to death, lack of oxygen to the brain is the common factor.
translation.ja: 死の直前にある脳は 概して酸欠状態にあるためだ

translation.en: However, we know, from decades of research, what happens when you get lack of oxygen.
translation.ja: しかし長年の研究から 脳が酸欠状態に陥ると―

translation.en: People become frightened, become belligerent, become terrified of what's happening to them.
translation.ja: 人は恐れ 好戦的になり 死におびえる

translation.en: Very much unlike the calm, consistent, almost blissful experience of a near death experience.
translation.ja: 穏やかで至福の体験という 報告とは異なる

translation.en: I'm frequently challenged by people who say,
translation.ja: 答えに困る質問をされる

translation.en: "Okay, he's had a cardiac arrest.
translation.ja: 心停止患者なら― 精神神経科医 ピーター･ フェンウィック

translation.en: There's a little bit of brain which is working,
translation.ja: 精神神経科医 ピーター･ フェンウィック 働いてる脳が どこかにあったのでは？

translation.en: which you guys have all missed."
translation.ja: 働いてる脳が どこかにあったのでは？

translation.en: But this says that they don't really understand what consciousness is.
translation.ja: この話をする人は 意識を理解していない

translation.en: You cannot maintain consciousness
translation.ja: 意識を維持するためには

translation.en: unless you have a highly-organized brain.
translation.ja: 高度に機能する脳が必要だ

translation.en: Believe you me, when the brain loses its oxygen,
translation.ja: 事実 酸素を失った脳は

translation.en: -it doesn't organize itself. -[rhythmic bleeping]
translation.ja: 自力では機能できない

translation.en: [Bruce] When the heart stops, -in 20 seconds or so... -[continuous bleep]
translation.ja: 心臓が止まると20秒ほどで

translation.en: ...you get flatlining, which means no brain activity.
translation.ja: 脳の活動は完全に消える

translation.en: And yet people have near death experiences when they've been, quote, "flatlined" for longer than that.
translation.ja: だが脳活動が停止した例でも 臨死体験が報告された

translation.en: One of the most widely publicized cases was that of Pam Reynolds,
translation.ja: ２００５年 パム･レイノルズ 最も有名な患者は パム･レイノルズ

translation.en: who had an aneurysm, which is a ballooning of a blood vessel at the base of her brain.
translation.ja: 脳の基底部で 動脈瘤(りゅう)が発見された

translation.en: And it was so large that, if it burst, it would have killed her instantly.
translation.ja: 動脈瘤は巨大で 破裂すれば即死する

translation.en: The most that they could do for me was try...
translation.ja: 手術をしてみるしか 方法はないと言われた

translation.en: a surgical process which involved the stopping of the heart,
translation.ja: 手術をしてみるしか 方法はないと言われた 心臓を止め

translation.en: the lowering of the bodily temperature,
translation.ja: 体温を下げ

translation.en: the emptying of the blood from the body,
translation.ja: 体から血を抜いて

translation.en: thereby shrinking the aneurysm.
translation.ja: 動脈瘤を縮小させる

translation.en: [Bruce] She was without any blood going to her brain for about an hour.
translation.ja: １時間ほど脳の血流を止めた

translation.en: The EEG, or the brainwave, goes totally flat.
translation.ja: 脳波は完全に平らになり

translation.en: There is no brain activity at all.
translation.ja: 脳活動はまったくない

translation.en: Which presumably means there's no brain function at all during that time.
translation.ja: つまり推定上は 脳が機能していなかった

translation.en: And yet, she reported a blissful near-death experience
translation.ja: しかし彼女は臨死体験を報告

translation.en: in which she saw and heard things going on in the operating room
translation.ja: 手術中に周囲の様子を 見聞きしたという

translation.en: that she couldn't possibly have seen or heard.
translation.ja: 不可能なはずだ

translation.en: [Pam] My vantage point was rather like sitting on the shoulder of the surgeon.
translation.ja: 外科医の肩に座った位置に 視点があり―

translation.en: And I was free to move around at will.
translation.ja: 好きな場所へと 自由に動き回れた

translation.en: While I knew what they were doing, they didn't know what I was doing.
translation.ja: 私が見てることを 医師たちは知らない

translation.en: They thought I was that thing lying on the table.
translation.ja: 台の上に寝てると思ってる

translation.en: [Bruce] Now, her eyes were taped shut for the entire procedure,
translation.ja: 術中は目をテープで閉じ―

translation.en: and she had molded earpieces in her ears.
translation.ja: 両耳にイヤホンをしていた

translation.en: But she described the tools they were using to saw through her skull,
translation.ja: でも彼女は手術道具を 言い当てた でも彼女は手術道具を 言い当てた ２００５年製 マイダスレックスドリル

translation.en: and it was something that she hadn't seen before or after.
translation.ja: ２００５年製 マイダスレックスドリル 見たこともないのにだ

translation.en: [Pam] I saw, in Dr. Spetzler's hand,
translation.ja: 見えたのは執刀医の手

translation.en: an instrument that reminded me suspiciously of an electric toothbrush.
translation.ja: それと電動歯ブラシを 思い起こさせるような道具

translation.en: There was a case very close to it, and it had bits...
translation.ja: 近くに部品が入った ケースがあった

translation.en: that looked like the... case that my father kept his socket wrenches in.
translation.ja: ソケットレンチの 入れ物のような箱よ

translation.en: [Bruce] Her neurosurgeon said he can't understand how this could possibly happen.
translation.ja: 神経外科医にも 理解できなかった

translation.en: If somebody asked me to describe what the Midas Rex drill, uh, looked like,
translation.ja: ２００５年 パムの神経外科医 ロバート･スペッツラー このドリルの特徴を 誰かに教えるなら このドリルの特徴を 誰かに教えるなら

translation.en: I might very well use the term, "Like an electric toothbrush."
translation.ja: 私も電動歯ブラシだと 言うだろう

translation.en: And describing them, uh, as if they were a socket wrench set,
translation.ja: ソケットレンチの セットという形も―

translation.en: uh, I think that's very appropriate.
translation.ja: 最適な描写だ

translation.ja: 出産予定日の朝

translation.ja: 娘に朝食を作っていたら

translation.ja: 突然 辺りが血まみれに

translation.ja: 子守に付添を頼むと 彼女が運転席に座った

translation.ja: “私が運転する”と言うと “出血してる”と

translation.ja: 夫はニューヨークにいた

translation.ja: 急いでシカゴに戻った

translation.ja: “私は世界一 幸せだった 赤ちゃんをよろしく”と

translation.ja: カーテンがかけられ 帝王切開になった

translation.ja: 生まれたジェイコブは 健康だった

translation.ja: すべてが 体の外から見る ３Ｄ映画のようだった

translation.ja: 私の視点は 自分の上や横にあり

translation.ja: 手術室が見渡せた

translation.ja: 足元には麻酔科医がいて

translation.ja: 心肺蘇生をした人も見えた

translation.ja: 別次元では空間関係が崩れ

translation.ja: 母方のおじもいた

translation.ja: 彼らが知りたいのは

translation.en: Thank you.

translation.en: I used to be more easy-going before this all happened. Um...
translation.ja: 以前の私は もっと楽観的な性格だった

translation.en: I used to laugh more. Uh...
translation.ja: よく笑ってた

translation.en: And...
translation.ja: それに

translation.en: I used to not take things so seriously.
translation.ja: 深く考えない性格だった

translation.en: I-- I think Jonathan misses that part of me.
translation.ja: 多分 夫は気付いてない

translation.en: I think I'll be asking questions probably until the day I die. Again.
translation.ja: また死ぬ時まで 私は答えを探し続ける

translation.en: [Jose] The experience is very, very difficult to process.
translation.ja: 臨死体験を 理解するのは難しい

translation.en: The dying is very difficult.
translation.ja: 死は とても難しい

translation.en: A few years after my experience, I started painting.
translation.ja: 臨死体験の数年後 絵を描き始めた

translation.en: Had no idea. I'd never painted in my life.
translation.ja: それまで経験はない

translation.en: Initially, it was just a desire to reproduce what I saw...
translation.ja: あの世で見たものを 描きたかった

translation.en: where I was in a ball of color...
translation.ja: そこで私は色の塊だった

translation.en: and these colors were all moving, and I become the color.
translation.ja: 色が動き回り自分も色になる

translation.en: That's how I wound up doing art.
translation.ja: だから絵を始めた

translation.en: Just a desire to try to create that three-dimensional feeling with color.
translation.ja: ３次元的な色彩感覚を 表現したかった

translation.en: But as I kept doing it more and more, I began to realize that it's a lot deeper than that.
translation.ja: だが描けば描くほど 絵の奥深さに気付いた

translation.en: It was healing. It was healing me.
translation.ja: 絵は癒しになる

translation.en: Dying is traumatic.
translation.ja: 死は衝撃的だ

translation.en: And it's difficult to integrate and-- and get past that.
translation.ja: 死を理解するのも 克服するのも難しい

translation.en: This world of art and color... brought a lot of peace and calm into my life,
translation.ja: 色の世界は 私の人生を 平和で穏やかなものにし

translation.en: and it made me feel a sense of knowing.
translation.ja: 既知感を与えてくれた

translation.en: People ask me if the experience was real or not.
translation.ja: 体験は本当かと聞かれる

translation.en: At the end of the day, I can't prove to you.
translation.ja: 証拠は見せられないが

translation.en: I can only share my experience with you.
translation.ja: 体験は共有できる

translation.en: [Mary] I had more motivation
translation.ja: 私に起きた臨死体験は

translation.en: than any other person on this planet to disprove my account.
translation.ja: 誰よりも私が 幻だったと思いたい

translation.en: Because during my near-death experience, when I was with these beings...
translation.ja: 臨死体験の間に出会った 存在たちは―

translation.en: they told me about the coming and unexpected death of my oldest son, Willie,
translation.ja: 長男ウィリーの不慮の死を 私に告げた

translation.en: who was only nine years old at the time of my accident.
translation.ja: 彼は当時 まだ９歳だった

translation.en: I knew that if I could come up with any other plausible explanation,
translation.ja: 他に納得できる説明が できるなら―

translation.en: that I would be able to discount everything I'd been told.
translation.ja: お告げを無視したかった

translation.en: I wasn't given details in terms of the date and time of his death,
translation.ja: 息子の死亡日時の詳細は 告げられなかったけど

translation.en: but it was very concrete information
translation.ja: その確かな情報を知って 私は感じた

translation.en: that made me think he would never live to be 18.
translation.ja: その確かな情報を知って 私は感じた 18歳まで生きないと

translation.en: And...
translation.ja: 私は…

translation.en: I asked why.
translation.ja: 理由を聞いた

translation.en: You know, why... Why Willie? Why my son?
translation.ja: “なぜウィリーなの？”

translation.en: And I was told that beauty comes of all things.
translation.ja: 答えは“命あるものは死ぬ”

translation.en: You can imagine how difficult it was
translation.ja: どれだけつらかったか 言うまでもない

translation.en: to wake up every day wondering if that would be the day that my son died.
translation.ja: 朝 目覚めるたび― 息子が死ぬ日ではと考えた

translation.en: I did not tell anyone about that...
translation.ja: お告げのことは 誰にも話さなかった

translation.en: until shortly before Willie's 18th birthday.
translation.ja: 息子が18歳になる数日前に―

translation.en: We were at a ski race...
translation.ja: スキーの試合があった

translation.en: and I knocked on Willie's hotel room door at about four in the morning...
translation.ja: 息子のホテルのドアを 朝４時にたたいて―

translation.en: and told him.
translation.ja: 本人に話した

translation.en: [laughing] And he thought-- he thought I was crazy.
translation.ja: 息子は“頭がおかしい”って

translation.en: But I told him and he...
translation.ja: でも その時は―

translation.en: took it in stride.
translation.ja: 死を逃れた

translation.en: So when he reached his 18th birthday, I relaxed.
translation.ja: 息子が18歳になり 胸をなでおろした

translation.en: I sort of thought the plan for his life had changed.
translation.ja: 運命が変わったんだと

translation.en: About two years later...
translation.ja: それから２年後

translation.en: Willie was at a ski camp in Maine.
translation.ja: 息子はスキー合宿で―

translation.en: He was roller-skiing, which is a cross-country, dry landform of skiing...
translation.ja: クロスカントリーに向けて ローラースキーをしてた

translation.en: with a friend of his, and a...
translation.ja: 彼は友達と一緒にいて

translation.en: car missed her and hit him and killed him instantly.
translation.ja: 友達を避けた車に はねられて即死した

translation.en: The world stopped.
translation.ja: 時が止まった

translation.en: My experience, uh, did not...
translation.ja: 私は臨死体験をしたけど

translation.en: and does not protect me from grief.
translation.ja: 息子を守ることは できなかった

translation.en: I love... I loved my son and continue to love him...
translation.ja: あの子のことは とても深く愛してた

translation.en: more than I can imagine.
translation.ja: 自分が思うよりずっと

translation.en: But my near-death experience changes how I understand death.
translation.ja: でも臨死体験は 私の死への観念を変えた

translation.en: Death is not the final word and it's not the end.
translation.ja: 死は終わりではなく その先がある

translation.en: Death is just the physical loss.
translation.ja: 死は肉体を失うだけ

translation.en: I know my son is...
translation.ja: 息子はいる

translation.en: somewhere. [laughs]
translation.ja: どこかに

translation.en: And I know that I'll see him again.
translation.ja: きっと また会える

translation.en: [Bruce] If it is true that consciousness is not solely dependent on the brain...
translation.ja: 意識が脳だけに 依存するものではないなら

translation.en: that raises the question,
translation.ja: 疑問が残る

translation.en: "What happens to consciousness after we die?"
translation.ja: 意識は 死後どうなるのか？

translation.en: Can a consciousness continue after the death of the body
translation.ja: 死後も存続するのか？

translation.en: and communicate with people who are still alive?
translation.ja: 生者と交信できるのか？

translation.en: When I was four, I used to see spirits. I'd get messages from them.
translation.ja: ４歳の頃から 霊魂の伝言を聞いてる

translation.en: So I'm hopin' you're gonna enjoy this evening.
translation.ja: 今日は ぜひ楽しんで

translation.en: There will be some laughter, there may be some tears,
translation.ja: 笑いあり 涙あり

translation.en: and I'll do my best to get as many messages out as is possible.
translation.ja: 霊媒師 サンドラ･オハラ できるだけ大勢に 伝言を届けます できるだけ大勢に 伝言を届けます

translation.en: I would see people that other people couldn't see. But I didn't realize that they were not living people.
translation.ja: 他の人には見えない何かを 死者とは知らずに見てた

translation.en: [woman] As mediums, we open ourselves up to the spirit world.
translation.ja: 霊媒師の仕事は 霊界への道を開くこと

translation.en: We create a meeting space for both worlds to be united.
translation.ja: この世とあの世が つながる場所を作ります
